home.projectIntro: Berlin lacks accessible and convenient drinking fountains, and information about clean drinking water is often scattered and little known. This initiative helps make clean drinking water more accessible to city residents.
home.subproject1Description: We want information about free drinking water sources in Berlin to be more accessible. Therefore, we created our own map in Google Maps with a list of drinking fountains. You can add this map to your Google Maps and use it when needed.
home.subproject2Description: We advocate for the installation of new drinking fountains in high-traffic areas in Pankow to provide free access to drinking water.

subprojects.subproject1FullDescription: Although Berlin offers many free drinking water points, information about them is often difficult to find - especially on platforms that are used daily, such as Google Maps.
subprojects.subproject1Details: We have already added drinking fountains from Berliner Wasserbetriebe and aim to create a comprehensive overview of free water sources in Berlin.
subprojects.subproject2FullDescription: Another part of our initiative is promoting the installation of new drinking fountains in high-traffic areas in Pankow.
subprojects.subproject2Details: We know that similar initiatives have already been successfully implemented in other districts of the city. We hope that by the end of our project, we will be able to prepare a guide that will help residents of other districts achieve the installation of drinking fountains in their areas.

about.title: About Our Initiative
about.intro: We, Nina and Maria, are currently working on a civil society project that aims to make information about free drinking water sources in Berlin more accessible. This is part of our participation in the Club Dialog e.V. program.
about.programInfo: About us and the "Informieren. Nachdenken. Aktivierung" project
about.programDescription: We are participating in the ["Informieren. Nachdenken. Aktivierung"](https://www.club-dialog.de/ina/) project by Club Dialog e.V. This program is aimed at Russian-speaking residents of Berlin and seeks to strengthen their political and social participation. The program covers topics from democracy and civil society to practical skills for implementing one's own civil society initiatives.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This privacy policy informs you about the nature, scope, and purpose of the processing of personal data within our online offering in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) applicable in Germany.
privacy.responsiblePartyContent:
Berlin Drinking Fountains Initiative
Email: berlinertrinkbrunnen@gmail.com
privacy.dataProcessedContent:
Our website processes only limited usage data necessary to improve our service, specifically:

No other personal data such as names, email addresses, or contact details are collected or processed by us.

For more information about how Vercel processes data, please see their [Privacy Policy](https://vercel.com/legal/privacy-policy).

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.intro: Find answers to common questions about our drinking fountains initiative.

questions.faq1Question: How can I find drinking fountains near me?
questions.faq1Answer: We are working on adding all drinking fountains and refill stations to Google Maps. You can also check the official Berliner Wasserbetriebe website or use apps like Refill Deutschland.
questions.faq2Question: Are the drinking fountains safe to use?
questions.faq2Answer: Yes, all public drinking fountains in Berlin are regularly tested and maintained by Berliner Wasserbetriebe. The water quality meets all EU drinking water standards.
questions.faq5Question: How can I support your initiative?
questions.faq5Answer: You can help by spreading awareness, suggesting new fountain locations, or volunteering to help us map existing water sources. Contact us at berlinertrinkbrunnen@gmail.com.
questions.faq6Answer: We are starting with Pankow as a pilot project because we live there and can better assess local needs.

news.title: Project Start
news.content: We realized that we want more drinking fountains in Berlin.

news.title: Letter to Berliner Wasserbetriebe
news.content: We wrote a letter to Berliner Wasserbetriebe with a proposal to add existing drinking fountains to Google Maps and a question about the possibility of installing new drinking fountains in Pankow. Waiting for response.

news.title: Letter to Refill
news.content: We contacted Refill and asked them to share their experience with installing drinking fountains. Refill responded to our request.

news.title: Letter to VBB Pankow
news.content: We contacted VBB Pankow with a question about plans for installing drinking fountains and a proposal to install them at two actively used playgrounds. Waiting for response.

news.title: Beta version of map available for testing
news.content: We created a beta version of the map where you can find drinking fountains in Pankow and shared it with other project participants.

news.title: Website Launch
news.content: We launched a website where you can find information about our project and share your thoughts.
